title: Standard Deviation and Variance: Changing from KPH to MPH
question_text:
In most European countries, speed is measured in kilometers per hour. If we were to convert the speed from kilometers per hour to miles per hour, we would have to divide the speed by $1.61$.
What would happen to the standard deviation and variance in that case?

choices.text:
Standard Deviation: Remains the same
Variance: Remains the same

Standard Deviation: Remains the same
Variance: Divided by $1.61$

Standard Deviation: Divided by $1.61$
Variance: Remains the same

Standard Deviation: Divided by $1.61$
Variance: Divided by $1.61$

Standard Deviation: Divided by 1.61
Variance: Divided by 2.59

solution:
When everything is divided by 1.61, the standard deviation will also be divided by 1.61.

The variance represents the standard deviation squared.
Ïƒ2=(1.61)2=2.59
Therefore the variance will get divided by 2.59

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect because both the standard deviation and variance will change.

Choice 'B' is incorrect because the standard deviation will change and the variance will be divided by 2.59
.

Choice 'C' is incorrect because the variance will change.

Choice 'D' is incorrect because the variance will be divided by 2.59
